Simply put, causal inference is a field that provides inference on whether X causes Y – perhaps a one of the fundamental approach to modern day science. Causal inference, like everything else, is ever-evolving. It is a topic that spans across disciplines and has established roots in machine learning literature. For the most part, we are trying to figure out whether X causes Y. Isn’t that essentially what science does – cause and effect?
